The "base" is the area, so it's already squared in the example - if you would square the base again like you propose you basically would do a² * a² (= a to the power of 4, or 6 * 6 * 6 * 6 in the example), which is wrong.

@Teiwaz111  Yeah that makes a lot of sense it's just a little confusing to someone new to this.. Yeah you need 3 dimensions multiplied to get volume so base has to = l x w or (b)squared so that it's then multiplied by height to get volume/ cubed dimensions. It was just confusing the first time I saw it..

hi
Ancient calculation

spliting the sphere into infinite number of pyramids each has height equal to the radius of the sphere the volume of the pyramid equals basex height/3 the sum of the volumes of all pyramids equals the volume of the sphere by taking height/3 as a common factor we are left with the sum of all bases and it equals the surface area of the sphere so we get height x 4πr2/ 3 since the height equals the radius so vol=4πr3/3
